get.summary: Get document in a form using OData format
get.description: Returns OData as JSON format and includes defined metadata.

requestBody.description:
Document body in JSON format. Key/value pairs of fields and their values to update. Some modes may not allow any editable fields, in which case an empty JSON object should be passed.

The Key "Form" is required, and also it should have configured mode "odata" beforehand.

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description:
This field records the current revision version of document. It's a 32-character hex-encoded string of date. 

If db config "requireRevisionToUpdate" is enabled, then revision is required when update document and only update document when revision version is right.

post.summary: Runs an agent in a database, in real time
post.description:
Runs an existing agent, serverside. Existing limits of agent execution duration apply. This should only be used for short-running agents and simulated calling the agent from a browser

Formula type agent's target is anything other than "None" is unsupported trigger.

Unsupported trigger will get "Unsupported trigger and search in the background or embedded agent"

parameters.description: Scope name

/run/agentWithContext.summary: Runs an existing agent in a given database using a specific document as the agent's run context
/run/agentWithContext.description:
Provide an array of UNIDs, each unid will be executed by the agent. 
NOTE : NotesSession.documentContext must be used in the agent to access the relevant document.

requestBody.description: Name of agent

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: Scope name

post.summary: Runs an agent in a database, in real time, passing a document for context
post.description: Runs an existing agent, serverside, passing an UNID of a document to act upon. NotesSession.documentContext can be used in the agent to access the relevant document. Existing limits of agent execution duration apply. This should only be used for short-running agents and simulated calling the agent from a browser.

/raw.summary: Create a document in the database for a specified form.  And it returns a NotesDocument object that represents the document.
/raw.description:
Create a document in the database for a specified form.  And it returns a NotesDocument object that represents the document.
No schema to normalize or filter the document is applied. Json is written as-is into the Note.

To be able to use this endpoint a form mode "raw" must exist for the value of "form" in JSON
and the current user needs the permission (set by formula in the "raw" mode) to use the mode

requestBody.description: Document body in JSON format. Key/value pairs of fields and their values to update, 'Form' is required.

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: Scope name

parameters.name: parentUnid
parameters.description: UNID of an existing document, to make this a response document

parameters.name: form
parameters.description: Name of the form to create a document for

post.description: Create a new document for a specified form.

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: Scope name

/raw/{unid}.summary: Acts on a document without a schema conversion applied
/raw/{unid}.description:
No schema to normalize or filter the document is applied. Json is read/written as-is from/into the Note.

To be able to use this endpoint a form mode "raw" must exist for the value of "form" in JSON (write)
or the value of the "form" item in the document (read) 
and the current user needs the permission (set by formula in the "raw" mode) to use the mode

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: Scope name

parameters.name: computeWithForm
parameters.description: Should a document be computed with its form's "Default Value", "Input Translation" and "Input Validation" formulas before retrieval

get.summary: Retrieve a given document with all items
get.description:
All items are returned, no item name normalization or translation is applied
No schema to normalize or filter the document is applied. Json is returned as-is from the Note.

To be able to use this endpoint a form mode "raw" must exist for the value of "form" item in the document
and the current user needs the permission (set by formula in the "raw" mode) to use the mode

Use on your own risk!

requestBody.description: Key/value pairs of fields and their values to update. Some modes may not allow any editable fields, in which case an empty JSON object should be passed. 'Form' is required.

parameters.name: parentUnid
parameters.description: UNID of an existing document, to make this a response document

and the current user needs the permission (set by formula in the "raw" mode) to use the mode

Use on your own risk!

/document/{unid}.summary: Actions on a document at a specific mode
/document/{unid}.description:
Update access to a document will typically restrict which fields on the document can be changed.

Modes are used to define statuses for a document, and will a definition identifying which fields can be seen and changed. A patch request that includes fields outside those restrictions will throw a 400 error (bad request), specifying which fields are illegal or missing.

Default is true

parameters.description: at which entry should return values start (zero based), default = 0

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Useful for categorized or sorted lists. Limits return values to entries matching the key or keys. Use multiple key parameter items to specify multiple keys in request URL.  The keys specified must be in the same order as the sorted columns from left to right. Unsorted columns will be ignored.

parameters.name: keyAllowPartial
parameters.description: Select by partial Key.  Default is false (key match is exact)

parameters.description: Shall the query return documents instead of view entries

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: Column for alternative sorting. This requires the list to be designed for indexing on this column

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction for alternative sorting. This is ignored unless "column" query parameter is passed as well. This requires the list to be designed for indexing on this column in the desired direction. Defaults to ascending if column is set.

parameters.name: startsWith
parameters.description: A character combination to perform a partial match to identify a starting point. The character combination will be applied to the "column" and "direction" passed in the query string. This cannot be combined with the "keys" parameter, i.e. you cannot filter on keys and startwith within that key.

parameters.name: richTextAs
parameters.description: The format RichText fields will be returned when retrieving documents instead of view entries.  The default if unspecified is mime.

parameters.name: distinctDocuments
parameters.description: Determines whether, when documents=true, only distinct documents should be retrieved if they exist multiple times in the list.

parameters.name: markRead
parameters.description: When retrieving documents instead of view entries, mark them as read by the current user after retrieval

parameters.name: markUnread
parameters.description: When retrieving documents instead of view entries, mark them as unread by the current user after retrieval

parameters.name: unreadOnly
parameters.description: Retrieve only unread entries. Cannot be combined with documents=true, documentsOnly=true, or methods to select or query documents

parameters.name: ftSearchQuery
parameters.description: Full-text search query to filter the contents of the list

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Category to restrict view queries to

parameters.name: startKey
parameters.description: Key value for the first entry to retrieve. This is treated as a greater-than-or-equal lookup

parameters.name: untilKey
parameters.description: Key value to stop traversal when used in combination with startKey. This is treated as a greater-than-or-equal lookup and represents the first value to not return

parameters.name: keyType
parameters.description: The type of the keys used in startKey and untilKey

BasicAuthRequest.title: Root Type for BasicAuthRequest
BasicAuthRequest.description: API way to get a token

password.description: Password, not written on a Post-it

username.description: Who you are or your eMail

scope.description: Optional approved scopes. A scope is a string, the scope field a series of space separated strings. If omitted the default value "MAIL $DATA" that give access to PIM functions and any database the user has access to. Other scopes can be the name of database aliases like "demo", "crm". The values are case sensitive. Regular database scopes are lower case. Scopes can't open access, that's what ACLs do, but limit them. For a user driven login, this makes limited sense, so it is mostly to achieve JWT parameter parity, so scopes can be tested without an IdP issuing a JWT at the end of an OAuth process

@documentset.description:
Represents a specified set of target documents that are manipulated by an agent.

The following types run an agent on:

all - All the documents in the database.

allinview - All documents in a view.

modified - All new and modified documents.

runonce - The current document once.

selected - Only the selected documents.

unreadinview - All unread documents in a view.

none

KeepField.title: Root Type for KeepField
KeepField.description:
Field description for fields / items in a KeepFormMode.
Describes name, type, and multi-value capability.
Modeled after json-schema where multi-value = array
extension to json-schema limited to x-access-name
to specify Domino Names, Reader, Author nature
All other field copied from JSON Schema

name.description: Field name. While anything theoretical is possible we stick to letters and numbers with the first letter capitalized. Not a hard rule to accomodate existing data

type.description:
Data type, from JSON spec. Can be:
- object
- array
- string
- number
- integer
- boolean

multivalue.description:
Can the field process multiple values, HCL Domino style.
When missing => false

fieldGroup.description: Domino multi-value fields can be grouped together to form a kind oc child record in a document. The fieldGroup defines such a grouping. It only is relevant for multi-value fields and isn't populated by default

description.description: Long text explanation what the field is about
description.example: Enter the following information yada yada yada

format.description: Format definition for Strings, extended from json-schema with readers, authors, names, json

items.description: Item description can contain type and format

minitems.description: for array type: minimum number of items

fieldAccess.description: Determines the access to a field as Read/Write, ReadOnly or WriteOnly
